greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n, k) read by descending antidiagonals: A(1, 1) = 2, A(1, k) = 1 for k > 1, and for n > 1, A(n, k) = Sum_{d|n, d>=k} A010051(1+d)*[Sum_{i=0..valuation(n,1+d)} A((n/d)/((1+d)^i), 1+d)].
comment: This square array gives the values obtained from the recursive PARI-program that _M. F. Hasler_ has provided Oct 05 2009 for A014197, in its two-argument form.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10585; the first 145 antidiagonals of the array
program: A320000sq(n, k) = if(1==n, if(1==k,2,1), sumdiv(n, d, if(d>=k && isprime(d+1), my(p=d+1, q=n/d); sum(i=0, valuation(n, p), A320000sq(q/(p^i), p))))); \\ After _M. F. Hasler_'s code in A014197
A320000list(up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), i=0); for(a=1,oo, for(col=1,a, i++; if(i > up_to, return(v)); v[i] = A320000sq(col,(a-(col-1))))); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 03 2018
